content:
for each item below please bold the correct response. Bold only one response per item. Include proper spacing for any of the questions that are joint together
1. Social Anxiety Disorder is best characterized by fear of:
a) Separation from loved ones
b) A specific thing or situation
c) Criticism and Judgment by others; Embarrassment
d) Open Spaces or Crowds
2. Thethreeneuroamines,involvedinemotions and moods, are: Serotonin, Norepinephrine, and:
a) Acetylcholine
b) Dopamine c) GABA
d) Glutamate
3. ThebestpsychologicalinterventionforDental Anxietyis:
a) Inquire, Validate feelings, Reassure, Relaxation, CBT
b) Paradoxical Intention: give the patient a hard time back
c) Recommend taking an antianxiety medication prior to visit
d) Denial: ignore it and it will go away
4. Allofthefollowingmaybesymptomsof Panic Attack except:
a) Palpitations
b) Shortness of Breath
c) Sneezing
d) Impending Doom
5. Achronicfright,fight,flight,freezeresponse raises the risk of developing:
a) Heart Disease and Stroke
b) Obesity
c) Diabetes
d) All of the above
6. Chronic Stress, Anxiety Disorders, PTSD, and Depression are associated with:
a) A larger overactive amygdala and a smaller underactive
frontal cortex
b) A smaller underactive amygdala and a larger overactive frontal cortex
c) A smaller underactive amygdala and a smaller underactive frontal cortex
d) A larger overactive amygdala and a larger overactive frontal cortex
7. Thefoundationalcellofthenervoussystemisthe:
a) Synapse
b) Neuron
c) Glial Cell
d) Hippocampus
8. Memoryis:
a) Improved with chronic stress
b) Static and Unchangeable
c) Stored in specific “Memory Banks”
d) A dynamic process that can change over time
9. TheRelaxationResponsedecreasesallexcept:
a) Pulse
b) Respiratory Rate
c) Sleep
d) Blood Pressure
10.Symptoms associated with PTSD include:
a) Intrusion
b) Avoidance
c) Hyperarousal
d) All of the Above
